/></role></citRespParty></idCitation><idAbs><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P><SPAN>This feature class depicts the boundaries of the livestock grazing allotments under the jurisdiction of the Idaho Bureau of Land Management. A pasture is a sub-unit of a grazing allotment; each allotment is comprised of at least one pasture. An allotment is an area of land designated and managed for grazing of livestock. An allotment may include private and state lands, in addition to public lands under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management and/or other federal agencies. All allotments and pastures are recorded and tracked in BLM's Rangeland Administrative System (RAS). This GIS feature class provides a spatial component to pastures and allotments.</SPAN></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></idAbs><idPurp>The intended use of all data in the BLM's GIS library is to support diverse activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.</idPurp><idStatus><ProgCd value="004" /></idStatus><idPoC><rpOrgName>U.S. Bureau of Land Management, Idaho State Offices, Resources and Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Rangeland Management Specialist</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-4000</voiceNum><voiceNum>208-373-3800</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><country>US</country><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd></cntAddress><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="007" /></role><rpIndName>Chris Robbins</rpIndName></idPoC><resMaint><maintFreq><MaintFreqCd value="009" /></maintFreq><maintNote>Pastutres are dissolved weekly to update allotments.  NOTE: This is a dissolved product from pastures. NO EDITS ARE TO BE MADE TO THIS DATA. If data changes are needed they are to be made to the pasture lines and the coincident pasture polygons, which are the source for the dissolve process.</maintNote></resMaint><placeKeys><thesaName><resTitle>BLM Place</resTitle><date><pubDate>2006-12-28T00:00:00</pubDate></date></thesaName><thesaLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="US" /></thesaLang><keyword>Idaho</keyword></placeKeys><themeKeys><thesaName><resTitle>A-Z Index of U. S. Government Departments and Agencies</resTitle><resAltTitle>http://www.usa.gov/directory/federal/index.shtml</resAltTitle><date><reviseDate>2012-10-17T00:00:00</reviseDate></date><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm></thesaName><thesaLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="US" /></thesaLang><keyword>Bureau of Land Management</keyword><keyword>BLM</keyword><keyword>Department of the Interior</keyword><keyword>DOI</keyword></themeKeys><resConst><LegConsts><useLimit>The BLM assumes no responsibility for errors or omissions.  No warranty is made by the BLM as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data for individual use or aggregate use with other data; nor shall the act of distribution to contractors, partners, or beyond, constitute any such warranty for individual or aggregate data use with other data.  Although these data have been processed successfully on computers of BLM, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by BLM regarding the use of these data on any other system, or for general or scientific purposes, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.  In no event shall the BLM have any liability whatsoever for payment of any consequential, incidental, indirect, special, or tort damages of any kind, including, but not limited to, any loss of profits arising out of the use or reliance on the geographic data or arising out of the delivery, installation, operation, or support by BLM.</useLimit><othConsts>1A, Public Data.  None.</othConsts><accessConsts><RestrictCd value="008" /></accessConsts></LegConsts><Consts><useLimit><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P STYLE="margin:0 0 14 0;"><SPAN>These data are provided by the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdas is\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and might contain errors or omissions. The User assumes the entire risk associated with its use of these data and bears all responsibility in determining whether these data are fit for the User\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds intended use. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the sources from which they were derived, and both scale and accuracy may vary across the data set. These data might not have the accuracy, resolution, completeness, timeliness, or other characteristics appropriate for applications that potential users of the data may contemplate. The User is encouraged to carefully consider the content of the metadata file associated with these data. These data are neither legal documents nor land surveys, and must not be used as such. Official records may be referenced at most BLM offices. Please report any errors in the data to the BLM office from which it was obtained. The BLM should be cited as the data source in any products derived from these data. Any Users wishing to modify the data should describe the types of modifications they have performed. The User should not misrepresent the data, nor imply that changes made were approved or endorsed by BLM. This data may be updated by the BLM without notification.</SPAN></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></useLimit></Consts></resConst><dataLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="USA" Sync="TRUE" /></dataLang><suppInfo>This is a National Operations Center (NOC) national dataset. This dataset is designed to be spatially and schematically consistent with surrounding state's data to permit the aggregation into a single seamless dataset. This dataset is being compared with the surrounding states to identify border inconsistencies. There is a continuous ongoing effort to identify and resolve these issues. They will be resolved as soon as they are identified and adjoining state's Data Stewards can meet to discuss and agree on a mutual resolution. It should be noted that these are state maintained datasets and may upon aggregation exhibit slightly differing spatial characteristics depending on the originating state's GIS techniques and the techniques used in the NOC aggregation process.</suppInfo><dataChar><CharSetCd value="004" /></dataChar><themeKeys><thesaLang><languageCode value="eng" /><countryCode value="US" /></thesaLang><thesaName><resTitle>BLM Theme</resTitle><date><pubDate>2006-12-28T00:00:00</pubDate></date><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm></thesaName><keyword>range</keyword></themeKeys><themeKeys><thesaName><resTitle>Bureau of Land Management Corporate Metadata Repository Abbreviations and Glossary Search</resTitle><resAltTitle>BLM CMR </resAltTitle><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm><resEdDate>20130201</resEdDate></thesaName><keyword>allotment</keyword><keyword>pasture</keyword></themeKeys><themeKeys><keyword>grazing</keyword><keyword>livestock</keyword><keyword>Taylor Grazing Act</keyword><keyword>Rangeland Administrative System</keyword><keyword>RAS</keyword></themeKeys><dataScale><equScale><rfDenom>24000</rfDenom></equScale></dataScale><envirDesc Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143</envirDesc><spatRpType><SpatRepTypCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></spatRpType><dataExt><geoEle><GeoBndBox esriExtentType="search"><exTypeCode Sync="TRUE">1</exTypeCode><westBL Sync="TRUE">-117.483027</westBL><eastBL Sync="TRUE">-110.708848</eastBL><northBL Sync="TRUE">48.381666</northBL><southBL Sync="TRUE">41.877098</southBL></GeoBndBox></geoEle></dataExt><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="001" /></tpCat><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="002" /></tpCat><tpCat><TopicCatCd value="003" /></tpCat></dataIdInfo><mdMaint><maintFreq><MaintFreqCd value="009" /></maintFreq><maintNote>Last metadata review date: 20130212</maintNote></mdMaint><dqInfo><dqScope><scpLvl><ScopeCd value="005" /></scpLvl></dqScope><report type="DQCompOm" dimension="horizontal"><evalMethDesc>Allotments and pastures are checked against RAS by exporting out tables from both RAS and GIS and comparing them in Microsoft Acess.</evalMethDesc><measDesc>All allotments and pastures are recorded and tracked in BLM's Rangeland Administrative System (RAS).  These feature classes provide a spatial component  to support RAS. GIS should have all allotments and pastures that are in RAS and no more.  Some pastures and allotments extend over or are in adjacent states (Utah, Neavada, Oregon and Wyoming).  These alloments are managed by the Idaho Bureau of Land Management and are not comisssions.</measDesc><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="002" /></evalMethType><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>When new allotments are added to the geodatabase, they are checked against RAS to make sure the allotment name and number are in that system.  However, there are some allotments/pastures that are in GIS but not in RAS, and some allotments/pastures in RAS that are not in GIS.  It is estimated that less than 5% are omitted or comitted.</conExpl></ConResult></measResult></report><report type="DQDomConsis" dimension="horizontal"><evalMethDesc>Domains have been set up for ADMIN_ST. ADM_UNIT_CD, COORD_SOURCE_TYPE, COORD_SRC2, DEF_FET_TYPE,  and DEF_FET2.  At data entery, the user is forced to select only those values in the domain. </evalMethDesc><measDesc>BLM has a data standard that describes domains for ADMIN_ST. ADM_UNIT_CD,  COORD_SOURCE_TYPE, COORD_SRC2, DEF_FET_TYPE,  and DEF_FET2.</measDesc><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="001" /></evalMethType><evalProc><resTitle>Pasture and Allotment Boundaries Implementation Guidelines</resTitle><date><pubDate>2009-12-02T00:00:00</pubDate></date><resEd>version2.3</resEd><resEdDate>20091202</resEdDate><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior, Bureau of Land Management, Denver Federal Center, Progam Management Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role></citRespParty></evalProc><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>A visual inspection confirmed that values that have been entered matched the domain values.  However, many fields are null. </conExpl><conPass>0</conPass></ConResult></measResult></report><report type="DQConcConsis" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>Pastures consists of both polygon and line feature classes stored in a feature dataset in a file geodatabase; allotments are dissolved from pasture polygons.  Pasture arcs and polygons should be coincident.  Each allotment must have at least one pasture and a pasture cannot exist without an allotment.  There should not be any spatial allotment that does not exist in RAS.  Although currently RAS may have allotments that are not in the spatial data, the goal is to have the two systems match 1:1.</measDesc><evalMethDesc>The pasture/allotment standard has the following minimal geodatabase topolgy rules: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd gra_past_arc Must Not Overlap \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd gra_past_arc Must Be Covered By Boundary Of gra_past_poly \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd gra_past_arc Must Not Self-Overlap \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd gra_past_poly Must Not Overlap \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd gra_past_poly Boundary Must Be Covered By gra_past_arc  </evalMethDesc><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="001" /></evalMethType><evalProc><resTitle>Pasture and Allotment Boundaries Implementation Guidelines</resTitle><date><pubDate>2009-12-02T00:00:00</pubDate></date><resEd>version 2.3</resEd><resEdDate>20091202</resEdDate><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior, Bureau of Land Management, Denver Federal Center, Program Management Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress><city>Denver</city><adminArea>Colorado</adminArea></cntAddress></rpCntInfo></citRespParty></evalProc><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>Topology does not pass validation rules. Some pasture polygons don't have pasture lines.  Many errors still need to be fixed.  The pasture line feature class has noe been consistently maintained and has the most errors.  Most errors occur in the pasture feature classes; the allotment feature class boundary is the most accurate.</conExpl></ConResult></measResult></report><report type="DQAbsExtPosAcc" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>Pasture boundaries usually follow fences, although natural boundaries, such as cliifs and rivers may be used, Original data was digitized using project and allotment maps as reference. </measDesc><evalMethDesc>GPS data is now used to correct locations as time/budget allows. Features may also be compared to DRG and NAIP imagery, if they are visible, and be corrected. </evalMethDesc><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="002" /></evalMethType><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>Many pasture boundaries (and allotments since they are derived from pastures) are inaccurate because they have not been GPSd.  No test has been performed to determine the positional accuracy of this data.</conExpl></ConResult></measResult></report><dataLineage><prcStep><stepDesc>Statewide allotments gathered from field and district offices. Geometry checked and repaired. Null or Unknown allotments deleted. Fields attributed where possible.   The Allotments polygon feature class is a dissolved product from Pastures polygons. The following select by attributes command was issued to remove any allotment that did not have at least a 5 digit allotment number. There are many pastures which are not true range allotments and have allotment numbers which are less than five characters in length. This select command removes those pastures from the selection and any other pastures that do not have a full five digit allotment number. select allot_no like '_____' The dissolve was made on the selected set on allot_no. The allotments feature class was then joined in a one to many relationship with pastures and the remainder of the allotment information was copied from the pastures feature class into the allotments feature class.</stepDesc><stepProc><rpIndName>John Courtright</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Analyst</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3950</voiceNum><faxNum>208-373-3949</faxNum><voiceNum>208-373-3998</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role></stepProc><stepDateTm>2008-08-01T00:00:00</stepDateTm></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>Edits collected from Burley Field Office GIS specialist and compiled into SDE.</stepDesc><stepDateTm>2007-01-01T00:00:00</stepDateTm></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>Edits compiled from extracts given to Four Rivers Field Office and temporary Bruneau Field Office GIS specialists.</stepDesc><stepDateTm>2007-06-29T00:00:00</stepDateTm></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>The Idaho State Office data steward, Elena Shaw, Range Management Specialist, signed the ID-9167 Geospatial Data Quality Assurance/Quality Control Authorization on September 10, 2009.  It is available in the Idaho State Office for review.</stepDesc><stepDateTm>2009-09-10T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>John Courtright</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Analyst</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3998</voiceNum><voiceNum>208-373-3950</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></stepProc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>The original metadata document for this feature class was upgraded from ESRI version 9 to Version 10.0, Service Pack 4 using the ArcCatalog Upgrade tool and the FGDC-to-ArcGIS transformation.  The FGDC CSCGM and ESRI-ISO components of the metadata, except for the entity and attribute section, were then removed from ArcGIS metadata using the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdremove pre94 metadata elements.xslt\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd provided by ESRI.  Process steps that had the complete Idaho BLM Form ID-9167 Geospatial Data Quality Assurance/Quality Control Authorization Page were modified to only have a reference to the document to make metadata more readable.  </stepDesc><stepDateTm>2012-09-12T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>John Courtright</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Bureau of Land Management, Idaho State Offices, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>GIS Analyst</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3998</voiceNum><voiceNum>208-373-4000</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></stepProc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>The metadata was reviewed and additional changes were made to the metadata.   No changes were made to the actual data.</stepDesc><stepRat>The reason for the metadata edits was to provide consistency and clarification, and to edit outdated information.</stepRat><stepDateTm>2013-02-12T00:00:00</stepDateTm><stepProc><rpIndName>Connie Breckenridge</rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Specialist</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="009" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 South Vinnell Way</delPoint><city>Boise</city><adminArea>Idaho</adminArea><postCode>83709-1657</postCode><eMailAdd>id_so_information@blm.gov</eMailAdd><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3982</voiceNum><voiceNum>208-373-3998</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntHours>7:45 A.M. - 4:15 P.M., Mountain Time, Monday - Friday</cntHours></rpCntInfo></stepProc></prcStep><dataSource type=""><srcDesc>The data standards for developing and maintaining livestock grazing allotment and pasture boundaries in electronic format are found in Attachments 1 and 2 of this IM. All offices must use these standards when developing, amending, or maintaining electronic allotment and pasture boundary datasets.  Attachment 1, Pasture and Allotment Boundaries Data Standard Report, Dec. 28, 2009, version 2.3 provides the data model used by the standard.  Attachment 2, Pasture and Allotment Boundaries Implementation Guidelines, Dec. 2, 2009. ver. 2.3 describes the topology rules, data guidelines and review process that the standard uses. </srcDesc><srcCitatn><resTitle>Washington Office Instruction Memorandum No. 2010-076</resTitle><resAltTitle>Pasture and Allotment Boundaries Data Standard </resAltTitle><date><pubDate>2010-03-10T00:00:00</pubDate></date><presForm><fgdcGeoform>document</fgdcGeoform><PresFormCd value="001" /></presForm><citRespParty><rpIndName>Edwin L. Roberson                                            </rpIndName><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM)</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Assistant Director, Renewable Resources and Planning</rpPosName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role><rpCntInfo><cntAddress><city>Washington</city><adminArea>District of Columbia</adminArea><postCode>20240</postCode><country>UNITED STATES</country></cntAddress></rpCntInfo></citRespParty></srcCitatn></dataSource></dataLineage><report type="DQNonQuanAttAcc" dimension="horizontal"><measDesc>Most attribute information will come from the Rangeland Administrative System (RAS). </measDesc><evalMethType><EvalMethTypeCd value="002" /></evalMethType><evalMethDesc>Attributes will be compared to reports from RAS.</evalMethDesc><measResult><ConResult><conExpl>Errors are known to exist in attributes but no formal tests have been done.  There are many null values, especially in the fetaure level metadata for the lines.  Attributes in the spatial data do not always match RAS.</conExpl></ConResult></measResult><evalProc><resTitle>Grazing QA/QC Plan, GSSP National Data Sets Implementation</resTitle><date><pubDate>2010-06-30T00:00:00</pubDate></date><resEd>version 1.0</resEd><resEdDate>20100630</resEdDate></evalProc></report></dqInfo><dataSetFn><OnFunctCd value="001" /></dataSetFn><eainfo><detailed Name="RANGE_NOC_GrazingAllotments_PUB_100K_POLY"><enttyp><enttypl Sync="TRUE">RANGE_NOC_GrazingAllotments_PUB_100K_POLY</enttypl><enttypt Sync="TRUE">Feature Class</enttypt><enttypc Sync="TRUE">2100</enttypc></enttyp><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">FID</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">FID</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">OID</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef Sync="TRUE">Internal feature number.</attrdef><attrdefs Sync="TRUE">ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>ALLOT_NO</attrlabl><attrdef>Allotment Number</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM Pastrue and Allotment Boundaries Implemenation Guidelines</attrdefs><attalias Sync="TRUE">ALLOT_NO</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">5</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr></detailed><overview><eaover> Allowable Codes;  WO = winter use every other year, with no use extending in other seasons. SP = spring use every year with no use extending into other seasons. SS = use throughout critical growing season annually. SL = season long use annually, including growing season use. SF = early spring use and use after seed ripe every year. DR = rotation schedule including deferment from grazing periodically and use during the growing season periodically (i.e. flip-flop and two years deferment followed by one year of growing season use). DF = use is deferred until after critical growth period or seed set every year. RR = at least one year of rest from grazing is scheduled within the rotation. RE = grazed reservoir enclosure fenced to allow livestock access from two pastures. RX = reservoir exclosure riparian area rested from grazing. SX = stream riparian exclosure area rested from grazing. PX = spring riparian exclosure area rested from grazing. EX = experimental exclosure area; study or experimental plot rested from grazing. MX = area excluded from grazing to protect other resource values such as recreation sites, guzzlers, wells, disposal sites, or otherwise not suitable for grazing. UX = areas officially un-allotted or excluded from grazing via a land use planning decision.  This would require a land use plan amendment to change this designation. In contrast, the other types of exclosures listed above could be modified by an activity or project level decision. CU = area defined as custodial (C) allotment or fenced federal range (FFR). NO = no grazing system. </eaover></overview></eainfo><mdHrLvName Sync="TRUE">dataset</mdHrLvName><refSysInfo><RefSystem><refSysID><identCode code="102605" Sync="TRUE" value="102605" /><idCodeSpace Sync="TRUE">ESRI</idCodeSpace><idVersion Sync="TRUE">10.1.1</idVersion></refSysID></RefSystem></refSysInfo><spatRepInfo><VectSpatRep><geometObjs Name="RANGE_NOC_GrazingAllotments_PUB_100K_POLY"><geoObjTyp><GeoObjTypCd value="002" Sync="TRUE" /></geoObjTyp><geoObjCnt Sync="TRUE">2100</geoObjCnt></geometObjs><topLvl><TopoLevCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></topLvl></VectSpatRep></spatRepInfo><spdoinfo><ptvctinf><esriterm Name="RANGE_NOC_GrazingAllotments_PUB_100K_POLY"><efeatyp Sync="TRUE">Simple</efeatyp><efeageom code="4" Sync="TRUE" /><esritopo Sync="TRUE">FALSE</esritopo><efeacnt Sync="TRUE">2100</efeacnt><spindex Sync="TRUE">FALSE</spindex><linrefer Sync="TRUE">FALSE</linrefer></esriterm></ptvctinf></spdoinfo><mdDateSt Sync="TRUE">20130509</mdDateSt><distInfo><distFormat><formatName Sync="TRUE">Shapefile</formatName></distFormat><distTranOps><transSize Sync="TRUE">7.664</transSize></distTranOps><distributor xmlns=""><distorCont xmlns=""><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="005" /></role><rpCntInfo xmlns=""><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 S.
